<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/us-fully-open-business-inflation-hits-highest-rate-13-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Inflategate Strikes Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/us-fully-open-business-inflation-hits-highest-rate-13-years?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Dollar bill getting inflated by a bike pump" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzU2L2luZmxhdGlvbl9pbWFnZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Inflation is getting so bad Arizona might have to raise the price of its iced tea above $0.99.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Okay, it's not that horrific yet, but consumer prices did <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/us-consumer-prices-surge-june-2021-07-13/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surge 5.4%</a> in June from a year ago, the biggest increase in 13 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>As the US reopened for business, consumers swiped their credit cards with fury. Combine that with supply shortages across the economy and massive government stimulus, and you get sweeping price increases.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But there are nuances</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The WSJ’s<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>David Harrison divided the inflation report into <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/inflation-hits-some-prices-more-than-others-11626187838?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four categories</a> to show that price hikes aren’t occurring uniformly across the economy. In some sectors...<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Prices that plummeted early in the pandemic and are surging to catch up. </strong></span><span>Think airfares (24.6% annual increase in June) and hotels (16.9%).</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Prices that are booming thanks to supply shortages. </strong></span><span>Used cars are the star of this category, with their price increases accounting for more than a third of June’s total price hikes. Economists expect prices to return to normal levels when supply chain wrinkles are ironed out.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Prices that will remain higher permanently. </strong></span><span>You could be paying more at restaurants over the long term thanks to an extended labor shortage and higher wages.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Prices that aren’t increasing that much. </strong></span><span>Rents are inching upward at a rate of 1.9% per month. For comparison, rents on a primary residence rose at a nearly 4% rate before the pandemic.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As always with inflation stories, we must close by turning to the Fed, whose main job is to keep prices stable. Will June’s inflation boom change Chair Jerome Powell’s view that price hikes are transitory?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Probably not. As we mentioned, the bulk of the price increases were in sectors battered by the pandemic (hospitality) or those battling supply shortages (used cars). Higher inflation might stick around a little longer than initially expected, but investors are betting more typical price growth will return, just like the handshake. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For laughs: </strong>We had some <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1414969415473508355?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">inflation fun</a> with readers on Twitter.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/jpmorgan-goldman-sachs-pepsico-kick-off-earnings-season-strong?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Execs Say the Darndest Things
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/jpmorgan-goldman-sachs-pepsico-kick-off-earnings-season-strong?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="JPMorgan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDYvamFtaWVfZGltb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/jurvetson/8362210873/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/jurvetson/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jurvetson</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two banks and a food giant turned in quarterly report cards you'd be proud to show off to your parents. Here are execs' most quotable quotes from yesterday's earnings calls.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon:</strong> “Their house value is up. Their stock value is up. Their incomes are up. Their savings are up. Their confidence is up.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Consumers are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-profit-more-than-doubles-but-revenue-falls-11626174591?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">"raring" to spend more</a> this summer (great for JPMorgan’s credit card biz), but the company’s trading revenue dropped sharply in Q2 as the economy opened up.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon:</strong> “Obviously if there was some sort of a disruption or an economic slowdown sometime in the future, that would wear on confidence and slow that, but that doesn’t seem likely.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Goldman’s net revenue from investment banking jumped 36% annually to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-profit-revenue-jump-11626177091?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$3.6 billion</a> in Q2 thanks to an army of unicorns rushing to go public this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. PepsiCo CFO Hugh Johnston:</strong> “This quarter, all of a sudden people started going out.” In food service, “we saw the business double in a relatively short period of time.”                                                                    </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pepsi sales <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-13/pepsi-sales-soar-with-hungry-thirsty-consumers-going-out-again?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped</a> the most in a decade last quarter as restaurant demand for its drinks returned. However, while people are getting out more, “they are not anywhere near where they were,” Johnston said.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/apple-reportedly-working-buynowpaylater-service?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple: You Want It? You Got It?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Impulse purchasing could get <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-13/apple-goldman-plan-buy-now-pay-later-service-to-rival-paypal?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">even easier</a>: Apple is working on adding a buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) feature to Apple Pay, dipping a gargantuan toe into one of retail’s fastest-growing segments, per Bloomberg. Here’s what we know about the service, known as “Apple Pay Later”:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’ll offer two ways to pay: four bi-weekly, interest-free installments or a long-term monthly plan with interest.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The service will work with any Apple Pay-enabled card, so no Apple Card is required.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Goldman Sachs, which is already Apple Card’s partner, has been tapped as the service’s lender.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s the strategy? </strong>Apple currently earns a cut of every Apple Pay purchase, so the more users buy, the more it makes. And a BNPL service could lead Apple users to make more big-ticket purchases. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>If Apple <em>does</em> release this product, it’ll be trampling on several other fintech companies’ turf. Affirm, Klarna, PayPal, and Sezzle all offer similar layaway programs. Following the Bloomberg report, Affirm shares fell as much as 13%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s core advantage (ha), and this goes for most new arenas it’s looking to play in, is that the tech giant’s already in so many people’s pockets.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This kid knows something. And judging by the size of his smile, it’s not just what’s on the inside of that arts and crafts box.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No, this kid is smiling like his parents read him Motley Fool’s <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5stocks-again?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-again&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0310010&psource=esamnbwdg0310010&wsource=esamnbwdg0310010" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latest stock picks</a>—and now he’s armed with stock market knowledge that’ll potentially put him in a good position to upgrade to a fancier pencil one day. You know, one that’s not a log.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Motley Fool has been pickin’ winners for years. If you’d invested in Amazon in 2002 when the Fool sent a “buy alert” at $15.31 per share, <strong style="color:#000">you’d be up 22,833%</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Unfortunately, you can’t go back in time to invest in Amazon.</strong> Fortunately, the Fool is about to provide you with a brand new, affordable opportunity to get in early on stocks with serious growth potential.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5stocks-again?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-again&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0310010&psource=esamnbwdg0310010&wsource=esamnbwdg0310010" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Click here to read the Fool’s “Five Growth Stocks Under $49."</a></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/key-performance-indicators-july-14?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Chart showing the best paying music streaming services" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzU1L2NoYXJ0X3Nob3dpbmdfdGhlX2Jlc3RfcGF5aW5nX211c2ljX3N0cmVhbWluZ19zZXJ2aWNlcy5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Peloton has the <a href="https://slate.com/culture/2021/07/peloton-music-royalties-spotify-apple-music.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest artist payout rate</a> of any music streaming service: 3.1 cents, compared to Spotify (.35 cents), Apple Music (0.68 cents), and YouTube (0.15 cents), according to Trichordist’s Streaming Price Bible. While its payouts are more generous, Peloton only accounts for 0.07% of global streams.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “It’s time to build some new used cars.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bloomberg’s Joe Weisenthal <a href="https://twitter.com/TheStalwart/status/1414931906752303128?s=09" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has the jokes</a> for the boom in used car prices.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> Jason Sudeikis is having one hell of a year. (<a href="https://www.gq.com/story/jason-sudeikis-august-cover-profile?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GQ</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/young-streaming-platforms-rake-2021-emmy-nominations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix, You Still Chilling?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/young-streaming-platforms-rake-2021-emmy-nominations?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="HBO Max" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTA1L3N0cmVhbWluZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The 2021 Emmy nominations were released yesterday, and it looks like Netflix’s single-handed domination could soon turn into a <a href="https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/2021-emmys-nominations-recap-mandalorian-crown-netflix-hbo-1235018492/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">battle royale</a> thanks to a pack of streaming toddlers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2018, Netflix knocked HBO off its perch as the top nominee-getter for the first time in 17 years, which symbolized the shift from cable → streaming. Netflix sat alone at the top for a while, nabbing the all-time nomination record last year with 160.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Disney+, HBO Max, and Apple TV+, all of which are less than three years old, are starting to nip at its heels with 71, 36, and 34 nominations this year, respectively. Netflix accounted for about 60% of all streaming nominations in 2020, but this year, its share is down to less than 40%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> The success of newer streamers at the Emmys may not matter for the average Netflix-and-chiller, but it reflects the fast growth of infant platforms. All the whippersnappers with strong Emmys showings revealed impressive viewership gains this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ The more you know: </strong><em>The Mandalorian</em> and <em>The Crown</em> topped the nominations with 24 each. <em>Ted Lasso</em> only got 20, but he was perfectly content with that.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Arcade wars: </strong>To celebrate the 40th anniversary of <em>Donkey Kong</em> this month, make sure you watch the movie (<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4zhMlFOyZvQ&t=3454s" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">for free on YouTube</a>) that explores the cutthroat battle to become the king of Kong. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Dream job alert: </strong>McCormick is hiring a <a href="https://www.mccormick.com/director-of-taco-relations?utm_source=pr&utm_medium=redirect&utm_campaign=taco-relations" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Director of Taco Relations</a>.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>The “responsibilities” include traveling across the country in search of the latest taco trends and helping to develop new taco recipes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You learn something new every day: </strong>Read a series of blog posts exploring <a href="https://commoncog.com/blog/the-tacit-knowledge-series/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tacit knowledge</a> and why it’s so important.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Resale is exploding: </strong>Learn about resale’s impact on traditional retail and sustainability at a Retail Brew event next week. <a href="https://events.morningbrew.com/thecheckoutpoweredbyretailbrewresale/Daily-NL?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Register here</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Word search: </strong>Our new Hump Day tradition asks you to find the words prompted by the visual clues. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/13/word-search-auto-logos?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Try it here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The Price Is Right</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because used cars have been the biggest contributor to inflation this summer, we decided to go shopping for one on cars.com.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here's the question: How much is a 2019 Ford F-150 XLT with 16,371 miles being sold for in Bend, Oregon? <em>Price Is Right</em> rules—you can’t go over. </p>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInflation is getting so bad Arizona might have to raise the price of its iced tea above $0.99.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOkay, it's not that horrific yet, but consumer prices did \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/us-consumer-prices-surge-june-2021-07-13/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurge 5.4%\u003c/a\u003e in June from a year ago, the biggest increase in 13 years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eAs the US reopened for business, consumers swiped their credit cards with fury. Combine that with supply shortages across the economy and massive government stimulus, and you get sweeping price increases.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut there are nuances\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe WSJ’s\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eDavid Harrison divided the inflation report into \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/inflation-hits-some-prices-more-than-others-11626187838?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour categories\u003c/a\u003e to show that price hikes aren’t occurring uniformly across the economy. In some sectors...\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePrices that plummeted early in the pandemic and are surging to catch up. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThink airfares (24.6% annual increase in June) and hotels (16.9%).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePrices that are booming thanks to supply shortages. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUsed cars are the star of this category, with their price increases accounting for more than a third of June’s total price hikes. Economists expect prices to return to normal levels when supply chain wrinkles are ironed out.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePrices that will remain higher permanently. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou could be paying more at restaurants over the long term thanks to an extended labor shortage and higher wages.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePrices that aren’t increasing that much. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRents are inching upward at a rate of 1.9% per month. For comparison, rents on a primary residence rose at a nearly 4% rate before the pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs always with inflation stories, we must close by turning to the Fed, whose main job is to keep prices stable. Will June’s inflation boom change Chair Jerome Powell’s view that price hikes are transitory?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eProbably not. As we mentioned, the bulk of the price increases were in sectors battered by the pandemic (hospitality) or those battling supply shortages (used cars). Higher inflation might stick around a little longer than initially expected, but investors are betting more typical price growth will return, just like the handshake. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo banks and a food giant turned in quarterly report cards you'd be proud to show off to your parents. Here are execs' most quotable quotes from yesterday's earnings calls.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon:\u003c/strong\u003e “Their house value is up. Their stock value is up. Their incomes are up. Their savings are up. Their confidence is up.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConsumers are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/jpmorgan-profit-more-than-doubles-but-revenue-falls-11626174591?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\"raring\" to spend more\u003c/a\u003e this summer (great for JPMorgan’s credit card biz), but the company’s trading revenue dropped sharply in Q2 as the economy opened up.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon:\u003c/strong\u003e “Obviously if there was some sort of a disruption or an economic slowdown sometime in the future, that would wear on confidence and slow that, but that doesn’t seem likely.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoldman’s net revenue from investment banking jumped 36% annually to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-profit-revenue-jump-11626177091?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$3.6 billion\u003c/a\u003e in Q2 thanks to an army of unicorns rushing to go public this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. PepsiCo CFO Hugh Johnston:\u003c/strong\u003e “This quarter, all of a sudden people started going out.” In food service, “we saw the business double in a relatively short period of time.”                                                                    \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePepsi sales \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-13/pepsi-sales-soar-with-hungry-thirsty-consumers-going-out-again?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped\u003c/a\u003e the most in a decade last quarter as restaurant demand for its drinks returned. However, while people are getting out more, “they are not anywhere near where they were,” Johnston said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F07%2F13%2Fjpmorgan-goldman-sachs-pepsico-kick-off-earnings-season-strong\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; You Got It?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eImpulse purchasing could get \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-13/apple-goldman-plan-buy-now-pay-later-service-to-rival-paypal?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeven easier\u003c/a\u003e: Apple is working on adding a buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) feature to Apple Pay, dipping a gargantuan toe into one of retail’s fastest-growing segments, per Bloomberg. Here’s what we know about the service, known as “Apple Pay Later”:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’ll offer two ways to pay: four bi-weekly, interest-free installments or a long-term monthly plan with interest.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe service will work with any Apple Pay-enabled card, so no Apple Card is required.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoldman Sachs, which is already Apple Card’s partner, has been tapped as the service’s lender.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s the strategy? \u003c/strong\u003eApple currently earns a cut of every Apple Pay purchase, so the more users buy, the more it makes. And a BNPL service could lead Apple users to make more big-ticket purchases. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIf Apple \u003cem\u003edoes\u003c/em\u003e release this product, it’ll be trampling on several other fintech companies’ turf. Affirm, Klarna, PayPal, and Sezzle all offer similar layaway programs. Following the Bloomberg report, Affirm shares fell as much as 13%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple’s core advantage (ha), and this goes for most new arenas it’s looking to play in, is that the tech giant’s already in so many people’s pockets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe 2021 Emmy nominations were released yesterday, and it looks like Netflix’s single-handed domination could soon turn into a \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/2021-emmys-nominations-recap-mandalorian-crown-netflix-hbo-1235018492/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebattle royale\u003c/a\u003e thanks to a pack of streaming toddlers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2018, Netflix knocked HBO off its perch as the top nominee-getter for the first time in 17 years, which symbolized the shift from cable → streaming. Netflix sat alone at the top for a while, nabbing the all-time nomination record last year with 160.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Disney+, HBO Max, and Apple TV+, all of which are less than three years old, are starting to nip at its heels with 71, 36, and 34 nominations this year, respectively. Netflix accounted for about 60% of all streaming nominations in 2020, but this year, its share is down to less than 40%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e The success of newer streamers at the Emmys may not matter for the average Netflix-and-chiller, but it reflects the fast growth of infant platforms. All the whippersnappers with strong Emmys showings revealed impressive viewership gains this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ The more you know: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Mandalorian\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003eThe Crown\u003c/em\u003e topped the nominations with 24 each. \u003cem\u003eTed Lasso\u003c/em\u003e only got 20, but he was perfectly content with that.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL
